text: Colony is a city in Anderson County, Kansas, United States. In 2020, 381 people lived there. ==History== Colony was created in 1872. This was when a railroad was built through the area. It was named after a colony from Ohio and Indiana, which settled in the neighborhood. The railroad tracks in Colony have since been changed to a rail trail. The trail is part of the Prairie Spirit Trail State Park. ==Geography== Colony is at (38.070803, -95.366109). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of . All of it is land. ===Weather=== Colony has hot, humid summers and generally mild to cool winters. Of the households, 78.6% owned their home and 21.4% rented their home. The median age was 43.3 years. Of the people, 91.9% were White, 0.8% were Native American, 0.3% Asian, 1.0% were from some other race, and 6.0% were two or more races. Hispanic or Latino of any race were 2.1% of the people. ===2010 census=== The 2010 census says that there were 408 people, 177 households, and 112 families living in Colony. ==Education== Colony is part of USD 479 Crest.USD 479 ==Famous people== * Dean Brooks, psychiatrist and actor ==References== ==Other websites== ;City * Colony - Directory of Public Officials ;School * USD 479, school district for Colony, Kincaid ;Historical * Colony History , Anderson County Historical Society * Numerous Anderson County documents and photos ;Maps * Colony City Map , KDOT Category:Cities in Anderson County, Kansas Category:1872 establishments in Kansas
